intro: Dodecatheon pulchellum var. monanthum, commonly known as the single-flowered glory of the snow, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, wooded areas and has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. It produces a single flower per stem, which blooms in early spring, making it a notable species in woodland gardens. The plant is also valued for its ecological role, providing nectar for early pollinators.
